clinical_study.brief_title: NIPE Monitoring Values During Routine Pediatric Anesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: Parasympathetic Activity Evaluation by Newborn Infant Parasympathetic Evaluation (NIPE) Monitor (MDMSTM, Loos, France) During Routine General Anesthesia in Children

brief_summary.textblock: Description of the standard values and fluctuations of the new NIPE index during routine pediatric anesthesia. NIPE monitor connected to anesthesia monitor, displays an instantaneous value ranging from 0 to 100. NIPE values described at different time points during anesthesia: beginning of induction, intubation, extubation, skin incision, opioid administration, vasopressors or atropine administration, transfusion, volume expansion. In addition, NIPE values during hemodynamic events (heart rate or blood pressure increase greater than 20%) will be recorded.

primary_outcome.measure: Variation of the instantaneous NIPE index after opioid administration

secondary_outcome.measure: the area under the ROC curve of NIPE value
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 5 minutes before the first hemodynamic event.
secondary_outcome.description: the NIPE value is definied by the predictibility of a hemodynamic event : 20% increase in Baseline heart rate, blood pressure and NIPE values recorded just before skin incision

secondary_outcome.measure: Variation of the instantaneous NIPE index after skin incision
Variation of the instantaneous NIPE index after insertion of airway control device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes after insertion of airway control device

secondary_outcome.measure: Variation of the instantaneous NIPE index after removal of airway control device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes after removal of airway control device

secondary_outcome.measure: Variation of the instantaneous NIPE index after anesthetic induction

arm_group.description: 0-15 years old children undergoing surgery under general anesthesia

intervention.description: Non invasive monitor connected to standard anesthesia monitor (no part of the device in contact with the patient) during anesthesia.

study_pop.textblock:
Children in the pediatric surgical wardof:
- Lille University hospital (Lille, France)
- Armand Trousseau Hospital (Paris, France)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Surgery under general anesthesia
- Absence of analgesic treatment in the 24 hours before the intervention
Exclusion Criteria:
- Central or peripheral neuropathy
- Non sinus arrythmia, pace maker
- Cardiac surgery
- Analgesic medication within 24 hours before surgery
- Anti cholinergic or anti arrythmic chronic medication
- Opposition of the legal tutor or of the child
